Content: Visited this beach because it was near our hotel. Nothing special. Stray dogs around this area. It seemed dirty. We didn't go into water.The view at Jimbaran is better.
review: visit near hotel nothing special stray dog around area seem dirty didnt go waterthe view jimbaran well

Content: A nice enough beach with areas marked off for the resorts and other areas open for local families to play. There’s a long reef off shore that creates great waves for surfing. The water is generally clear, with fish and sea snakes (!) swimming about. My one disappointment was the amount of rubbish in the water. Perhaps the hotels could be encouraged to leave garbage bins at the resorts for people to put a piece or two of rubbish in and help clean up the area.
review: nice enough area mark resort area open local family play there long reef shore create great wave surf water generally clear fish sea snake swim one disappointment amount rubbish water perhaps hotel encourage leave garbage bin resort people put piece two rubbish help clean area

Content: Beach is nice. However with the tide, when the sea pulls out, it turns into an extremely rocky area which isn't the nicest experience. Compared to Kuta or Seminyak on the other side of the island, Nusa Dua is quieter and much more private.
review: nice tide sea pull turn extremely rocky area isnt nice experience compare kuta seminyak side island nusa dua quieter much private

Content: Absolutely gorgeous, I felt like I was in paradise! However it is also the most expensive place I visited, a bottle of water cost £4 and in Bali that is an extortionate price, even in England it would be!
review: absolutely gorgeous felt paradise expensive place visit bottle water cost 4 bali extortionate price even england

Content: We found the beach areas in front of the major hotels to be very nice, but not well-maintained everywhere. We got up early to see the amazing sunrise views. In the mid-afternoon, we had massages on the beach, but further away from the water.
review: find area front major hotel nice wellmaintained everywhere get early see amazing sunrise view midafternoon massage away water

Content: Great sandy beach.....super for long walks.Water is clear...BUT EXPECT TONS OF GARBAGE (plastic bags in the water like I have not seen in any other part of the world.....)Huge disappointment !,,The hotels famous names like: Hyatt,  Mercure etc etc.....should invest in maintaining the beaches clean.....all they do is dig a hole in the sand and dump the trash...then cover it....NOT ACCEPTABLE! Shameful .
review: great sandy beachsuper long walkswater clearbut expect ton garbage plastic bag water see part worldhuge disappointment hotel famous name hyatt mercure etc etcshould invest maintain beach cleanall dig hole sand dump trashthen cover itnot acceptable shameful

Content: This long and beautiful beach looks great until you walk along the area where the water reaches the land. The amount of plastic and rubbish is upsetting and spoiling what should be an accessible paradise beach. The staff maintaining the beach are fighting  a losing battle.  They do sweep and collect what they can daily but sadly the volume is overwhelming.  Not the fault of the small number of hardworking people trying their best to fight a tide of rubbish and plastic which is an international problem.  We all need to do more to stop this - I did see a tourist, a dad with two young children, each pick up at least three pieces of plastic rubbish and carry them off the beach and put them into a bin - lesson to be learned.
review: long beautiful look great walk along area water reach land amount plastic rubbish upset spoil accessible paradise staff maintain fight losing battle sweep collect daily sadly volume overwhelm fault small number hardworking people try best fight tide rubbish plastic international problem need stop see tourist dad two young child pick least three piece plastic rubbish carry put bin lesson learn

Content: I came to Nusa Dua and suddenly i saw a banner with words 'Nusa Dua Lights Festival'.  It was such an amazing experience. I really enjoy the fest. So many food stans and others. Its really fun!
review: come nusa dua suddenly saw banner word nusa dua light festival amazing experience really enjoy fest many food stans others really fun

Content: Beach is ok, the sand is coarse and the area advised to stay within is very shallow, there is a lot of weeds and chorale at 4 feet depth and I would not venture into this area having seen the sea life in the rock pools when the tide was out.Was ok but not what we expected

Content: Clean, scenic and without big waves except high tide, this is a perfect place to start ones day and enjoy couple of other water sports with family. The absence of big waves means, one can enjoy over a greater area with knee length water for longer time. Absence of big waves also reduces danger and eye burning sensation. So while extreme water sport enthusiast might be disappointed, the families would enjoy the place much more than most other beaches. Recommended to stay in one of the resorts on beach for awesome holiday so one can use amenities. Lastly beach is clean, well maintained and offers excellent view without much outside crowd apart from hotels.

Content: Great beach if you are looking for privacy and experience of Bali beaches at the same time. Great for families

Content: Lovely white sandy beech but watch the waves and currents, they can take you unawares. One minute my husband paddling ankle deep in water the next he was in the water minus his sunglasses!There is a lifeguard but take care, particularly if you have children or you're not a strong swimmer.

Content: After travelling to Bali 10 times before, I decided to stay at the Laguna Hotel Nusa Dua.The beach was the best Ive seen so far in Bali and the Laguna was an amazing hotel. Content: Nice beach for relaxing and the Nusa Dua area is great to take it easy, totally contrasted with the business to the north in Kuta and Ubud. However, the beach isn't anything spectacular: unfortunately there's often rubbish such as plastic in the water, not to a huge degree but enough. Pretty good waves and very safe for swimming as the breakers are far out. It's very shallow for a long distance. For the best beaches nearby you need to take the boat out to Lembongan, there the coral is alive and thriving and the water is perfect.
review: nice relax nusa dua area great take easy totally contrasted business north kuta ubud isnt anything spectacular unfortunately there often rubbish plastic water huge degree enough pretty good wave safe swim breaker far shallow long distance best beach nearby need take boat lembongan coral alive thriving water perfect

Content: The Nusa Dua Beach is a very clean and tidy beach area with a lot of potential! In our one week holiday at Nusa Dua we spent about 3 days relaxing and hanging around at the beach and it was quite nice. The sand is brown, very clean but not that smooth. During the day the water level was low tide but clean. There a few locals trying to sell you stuff but they understand a simple no thank you and will then leave you alone.
review: nusa dua clean tidy area lot potential one week holiday nusa dua spend 3 day relax hang around quite nice sand brown clean smooth day water level low tide clean local try sell stuff understand simple thank will leave alone

Content: Pretty good beach I would say. Mostly people swimming outside the Inaya or Ayoda resorts. Colder than the hotel pools. Waves can pull you out a bit so be careful with children. See locals fishing out there as well. People surfing. Sand gets very hot during the day. Otherwise nice view and good to relax in front of with a beer.
review: pretty good say mostly people swim outside inaya ayoda resort colder hotel pool wave pull bit careful child see local fish well people surf sand get hot day nice view good relax front beer

Content: I recently swam at the Nusa Dua beach adjacent to the Grand Hyatt Resort. The combination of a protective reef, warmer water and relative absence of under tows made my water experience a memorable one. The water & sands are pristine & the gentle on shore breezes were very relaxing and perfect for the sport of kite flying. A short walk to the north takes you to the blowhole point where spectacular waves crash onto the rocks & explode high into the air to the delight of the many onlookers.  There are quite a lot of shade trees along the foreshore if sunbathing is not your thing which incidentally are populated by many cheeky squirrels who demand to be fed despite the practice being warned against by numerous signs in the area. To sum up, this is a beautiful clean beach which will not disappoint.
review: recently swim nusa dua adjacent grand hyatt resort combination protective reef warmer water relative absence tow make water experience memorable one water sand pristine gentle shore breeze relax perfect sport kite fly short walk north take blowhole point spectacular wave crash onto rock explode high air delight many onlooker quite lot shade tree along foreshore sunbathe thing incidentally populate many cheeky squirrel demand feed despite practice warn numerous sign area sum beautiful clean will disappoint

Content: AS beaches go in Bali this one is probably the best. Content: You should walk to one of the island, where locals bring their pets mostly dogs, and there is jogging track , too.
review: walk one island local bring pet mostly dog jog track

Content: The beaches are cleaned by the hotels, so they are really well kept. The best in Bali! Very long (at least 2 km) nice walking promenade-path by the ocean- especially at night!
review: beach clean hotel really well keep best bali long least 2 km nice walk promenadepath ocean especially night

Content: Hawkers are well controlled and not the slightest bit intimidating.  Plenty of staff keeping the beach clean and tidy.
review: hawker well control slight bit intimidate plenty staff keep clean tidy

Content: Beautiful, clean sandy beach, calm waters, perfect for families and for relaxing. Highly recommended.
review: beautiful clean sandy calm water perfect family relax highly recommend

Content: Nice calm waters, but not the clearest. Sand was a bit rocky. We've seen better in Hawaii and Zanzibar. Not too many water activities either. Wouldn't recommend flying here from the states for the beach
review: nice calm water clearest sand bit rocky weve see well hawaii zanzibar many water activity either wouldnt recommend fly state

Content: A local told us Nusa Dua is the most beautiful beach in Bali. It is definitely better than most beaches we have seen here but it is not a WOW one. All the resorts all located at Nusa Dua beach so it is quite crowded. The water is full of sea grass and other stuff... All in all it is a lovely long beach.
review: local tell u nusa dua beautiful bali definitely well beach see wow one resort locate nusa dua quite crowded water full sea grass stuff lovely long

Content: Visited this beach due to the location near to the place we stay. There are quite a number of hotels in the vicinity of the beach, many water sports activities here (jet ski, parasiling, canoing, etc). Just a short visit is fine.
review: visit due location near place stay quite number hotel vicinity many water sport activity jet ski parasiling canoe etc short visit fine

Content: Clean beach and not too crowded. i havent found a thing that i did not like about this beach, maybe the limited acces to the beach because the location are in limited complex
review: clean crowd havent find thing maybe limited acces location limit complex

Content: Nice and clean beach to relax and enjoy drink .clean water to swimming during vacation .recomended this beach
review: nice clean relax enjoy drink clean water swim vacation recomended

Content: Great surf and very family friendly beaches. Hire a surfboard or SUP, or grab a bike for a ride around the hotels.
review: great surf family friendly beach hire surfboard sup grab bike ride around hotel

Content: Nice area for a relaxed vacation. It was by no means seedy like Kuta.There are a lot of decent resorts to stay that are suitable for families swell.I will be returning.
review: nice area relax vacation mean seedy kutathere lot decent resort stay suitable family swelli will return

Content: had a private part of the beach as part of the hotel, but walked all along, spotless and beautiful sorry we didn't get to see the sunset!
review: private part part hotel walk along spotless beautiful sorry didnt see sunset

Content: Lovely clean beach. Some of the hotels should take more pride in there part of the beach thou. Our hotel had it cleaned every day at Inaya Putri.
review: lovely clean hotel take pride part thou hotel clean every day inaya putri

Content: The beaches are St Regis and The Laguna are really well maintained with plenty of privacy. The sea is fantastic once the tide is in
review: beach st regis laguna really well maintained plenty privacy sea fantastic tide

Content: Pretty and lively!  Not much to dislike.  Nice water temperature and clean.  Nice to stroll along the path and check out the other hotels on offer.
review: pretty lively much dislike nice water temperature clean nice stroll along path check hotel offer

Content: Ideal for surfing - beginers, there are many surfing schols, nice sand beach, not nice beach after 14.00 because of low tide...
review: ideal surf beginers many surf schols nice sand nice 1400 low tide

Content: Really liked Nusa dua, lovely people, nice restaurants........................ Shops nearby within waking distance.Near airport and resorts nice.
review: really liked nusa dua lovely people nice restaurant shop nearby within wake distancenear airport resort nice

Content: A great beach with shallow water. My son made friends with some local children and had a great time playing in the water and making sandcastles. Take a walk out to the water blow. - very cool! Take drinks and snacks as they can only be bought at the very expensive beachside restaurants.
review: great shallow water son make friend local child great time play water making sandcastles take walk water blow cool take drink snack buy expensive beachside restaurant

Content: Clean and crystal clear water, a perfect place for water sports such as jet skiing. Perfect for kids as well :)
review: clean crystal clear water perfect place water sport jet ski perfect kid well

Content: Nusa dua beach was quite big. Very graphical beach was lots of surfers. There were also placea were you could rent a board or even a sup and play around. Plenty of beach bars/cafes to have a cool drink or a snack
review: nusa dua quite big graphical lot surfer placea rent board even sup play around plenty barscafes cool drink snack

Content: Nusa Dua beach is a much more prestine beach - but all the beaches South Bali are.This one isn't the best but is the most commercialised and easiest to access. Prices are a bit costly here but the facilities and service is the best. The best restaurants and bars nearby compared to the other beaches south bali which are a lot more idyllic.A little bit more rubbish too due to high traffic.Maybe walk further down to Geger or further South or East for quieter nicer beaches.
review: nusa dua much prestine beach south bali arethis one isnt best commercialised easy access price bit costly facility service best best restaurant bar nearby compare beach south bali lot idyllica little bit rubbish due high trafficmaybe walk geger south east quieter nicer beach

Content: Nusa Dua beach is a long strip that runs parallel to fancy hotels, it is okayish, mostly hotel guests are to be found on there.It quite a long beachfront but the distance to the water is not that much, so one can sit by the bear while the kids play. It is clean and safe. If you walk towards the opposite side of the pier, you come to the real public side of the beach where locals hang and sellers sell their wares. I would suggest you make the trek. it is worth it.It is not Miami beach if you are staying at one of the hotels, this is more than adequate. I wouldn't get into a cab just to come visit though.
review: nusa dua long strip run parallel fancy hotel okayish mostly hotel guest find thereit quite long beachfront distance water much one sit bear kid play clean safe walk towards opposite side pier come real public side local hang seller sell war suggest make trek worth itit miami stay one hotel adequate wouldnt cab come visit though

Content: Nusa Dua Bali is a more private and peaceful beach, surrounding by the luxury hotel and resort, high security and pricey food around. If you are looking for this kind of environment for holiday, then it suites you, otherwise you may stay at the legian, kuta or seminyak which the location have more restaurants and shop around, reasonable price and nightlife surrounding.
review: nusa dua bali private peaceful surround luxury hotel resort high security pricey food around look kind environment holiday suit may stay legian kuta seminyak location restaurant shop around reasonable price nightlife surround

Content: White sands and quiet place to spend private time with family. At June the rocks were sharp, had to be careful with kids.
review: white sand quiet place spend private time family june rock sharp careful kid

Content: The price of alcoholic drinks and cigarettes on the beach can be negotiated. The boat trip organizers and masseuses on the beach will try every few hours to get you to have a massage. Avoid saying yes if you don’t intend to, because they get offended.
review: price alcoholic drink cigarette negotiate boat trip organizer masseuse will try every hour massage avoid say yes dont intend offend

Content: The public beach section at Nusa Dua is one of the best spots in Bali. Good beach, lovely ocean water, all the beach options, even though some are charging rates comparable to all the nearby large resorts. The local beach co-op has great food at cheap prices, and one of the best locations in Bali.
review: public section nusa dua one best spot bali good lovely ocean water option even though charge rate comparable nearby large resort local coop great food cheap price one best location bali

Content: very dirty beach and water,horrible .also i lot seller are coming and bothering the guests.i would not come again,awful dirty
review: dirty waterhorrible lot seller come bother guestsi come againawful dirty

Content: Nusa Dua beach is very clean and less crowded.  We stayed at Inaya Putri and had the beach access from the resort. Beach is safe for a swim and ideal for long walks.
review: nusa dua clean less crowded stayed inaya putri access resort safe swim ideal long walk

Content: The resort is so good, but when I came there, the sea is receded so I can see the trash in the waterfront. Because of that, I didn't want to play on the ocean, just in the beach.
review: resort good come sea recede see trash waterfront didnt want play ocean

Content: so beautiful and so clean, the pedlars didn't bother you if you said no, a quick walk along the beach to a great mall with great restaurants
review: beautiful clean pedlar didnt bother say quick walk along great mall great restaurant

Content: large beach made of soft sand , ideal for children to play on and not crowded. the water does not have any waves so ill not frighten little children.
review: large make soft sand ideal child play crowded water wave ill frighten little child

Content: Nice white sand but the tide goes out early so in the afternoon the sea has gone well out. Not the paradise beach I was expecting.
review: nice white sand tide go early afternoon sea go well paradise expect

Content: I don't surf so I was really looking for a nice and sandy beach in the area (not so many) and this is definitely the paradise beach. Nice and clear water, sandy (no rocks) and it has trees for those who don't like sun. It can get a little windy some days, but even so it's the best beach in Bali.
review: dont surf really look nice sandy area many definitely paradise nice clear water sandy rock tree dont sun little windy day even best bali

Content: Since I was staying in seminyak and spent time in kuta I was looking for a bit nicer beach. Ended up in Nusa Dua, was not disappointed at all. Quiet, clean, relax. Great experience. Easy and cheap to get there using GrabCar.
review: stay seminyak spent time kuta look bit nicer end nusa dua disappointed quiet clean relax great experience easy cheap use grabcar

Content: Lovely beach for Families as its protected from a small out of water reef not far off shore with some surf behind that that the boats can take you out if your keen for a surf. Most of the hotels have netted off the beaches so feels extra safe for tourists. Water is clean and the best bit is they dont allow hundreds of people trying to sell you things. There are only a small number of registered sellers but will not bother you.
review: lovely family protect small water reef far shore surf behind boat take keen surf hotel net beach feel extra safe tourist water clean best bit dont allow hundred people try sell thing small number register seller will bother

Content: Stayed at the Westin. Nice cocoon sun beds. Plenty of shade from the trees when it gets too hot. Kept very clean by the row if resort hotels along the sea front. Good walking path mainly in the shade. A lagoon beach. Great for a swim when the tide is high. Beautiful light late afternoon and a great spot to sit and have a drink / lunch/ dinner and watch the egrets and cormorants fishing for their dinner. Can do paddle boarding or kayaking. Despite all that is available it was a pretty quiet and relaxing beach. The jewellery and sarong sellers going up and down the beach can be quite persistent the first couple of days, but once you keep saying no they stop asking. Would definitely recommend this beach
review: stay westin nice cocoon sun bed plenty shade tree get hot kept clean row resort hotel along sea front good walk path mainly shade lagoon great swim tide high beautiful light late afternoon great spot sit drink lunch dinner watch egrets cormorant fish dinner paddle board kayak despite available pretty quiet relax jewellery sarong seller go quite persistent first couple day keep say stop ask definitely recommend

Content: Lovely place for water sports and relaxation. Be sure to bargain with sport vendors. The corn is amazing!
review: lovely place water sport relaxation sure bargain sport vendor corn amaze

Content: My daughter really loves this place. She likes to play with sand. The beach itself is very clean, and a nice place to hang out or relax
review: daughter really love place like play sand clean nice place hang relax

Content: Lovely clean beach with minimal current compared with the sea on the west side of Bali. Lovely yellow sand and nice views of Mount Agung and Nusa Penida on a clear day
review: lovely clean minimal current compare sea west side bali lovely yellow sand nice view mount agung nusa penida clear day

Content: What a wonderful discovery. White sand aquamarine ocean and not a piece of plastic in sight. A wonderful beach to spend the day.
review: wonderful discovery white sand aquamarine ocean piece plastic sight wonderful spend day

Content: The beach is fronted in some areas by a reef which keeps wave activity controlled. Be sure to visit the "water blow". Some of the walkway areas in the more public area where washed away by the last Cyclone, but still ok to walk. Also an easy beack walk to The Collection shops, with nice restaurants and shopping.
review: front area reef keep wave activity control sure visit water blow walkway area public area wash away last cyclone still ok walk easy beack walk collection shop nice restaurant shop

Content: Nice beach and nice weather. The hotel is also good. Our family had wonderful time there. We hope go there again someday.
review: nice nice weather hotel good family wonderful time hope go someday

Content: I visited Nusa Dua beach directly from my hotel (Inaya Putri Bali). The beach is amazingly clean and fully maintain, because I saw a man who always do clean up whenever the wave bring some trash to the beach, he will collect them and put to the proper place. My kids are really really love this beach...
review: visit nusa dua directly hotel inaya putri bali amazingly clean fully maintain saw man always clean whenever wave bring trash will collect put proper place kid really really love

Content: We enjoyed a variety of water sports. The most fun we had was on the Flying Fish. We did scuba diving too and the divers were all Padi certified.
review: enjoy variety water sport fun fly fish scuba dive diver padi certify

Content: We stayed at the Club Med Bali resort in Nusa Dua and walked along the beach past a number of resorts and hotels lining the beach to the south of Club Med. We found the beach here to be cleaner and less crowded than Kuta beach.
review: stay club med bali resort nusa dua walk along past number resort hotel line south club med find clean less crowded kuta

Content: Lovely Clean beach.  Hawkers are restricted on the beach, they can only come onto beach for 1 hour .  Each hawker has a licence number that gives them a certain time to go onto beach. This was fantastic as you were no constantly pestered while getting a  lovely tan.
review: lovely clean hawker restrict come onto 1 hour hawker licence number give certain time go onto fantastic constantly pester get lovely tan

Content: I didnt get a full view of the beaches.  Aron Bali cettainly made sure we knew where to go and the places to visit while there.  So, I give Aron a 10.  The beaches, not sure... Some in Seminyak seemed much nicer.
review: didnt full view beach aron bali cettainly make sure knew go place visit give aron 10 beach sure seminyak seem much nicer

Content: Nusa dua beach always been our favourite escape from the hectic life in Jakarta. The beach is clean, private, the view is great. We can just sit down and lie back under the tree and sleep without thinking about anything, what a relax way of spending a day!
review: nusa dua always favourite escape hectic life jakarta clean private view great sit lie back tree sleep without think anything relax way spending day

Content: This beach has probably the best teal water on the island, offering stunning views and also has a cycling road that allows you to take a ride around the place while not only enjoying the breeze but also getting to see the whole scenic place in a short time.
review: probably best teal water island offer stunning view cycle road allows take ride around place enjoy breeze get see whole scenic place short time

Content: This being my fourth visit to Indonesia, I have visited lots of beaches, Nusa Dua beach is definitely a favourite! I would recommend Nusa Dua Beach some where for families with young children to stay or couples wanting somewhere quiet to get away. The water is clear clean and calm most days. It is not as busy as most beaches. Although we had a beautiful lagoon like pool at our resort we chose to swim in the beach most days. Already planning a trip back with extended family!
review: fourth visit indonesia visit lot beach nusa dua definitely favourite recommend nusa dua family young child stay couple want somewhere quiet away water clear clean calm day busy beach although beautiful lagoon pool resort choose swim day already plan trip back extend family

Content: Well Nusa Dua beach has it all. Sun lounges, some shady trees, lovely clean beach with only a couple of licensed sellers. The ocean is refreshing and clean. You can get food, drinks, beer and ice cream. The fresh coconuts are fabulous, a must try.You just have to be careful not to get sun burnt.
review: well nusa dua sun lounge shady tree lovely clean couple license seller ocean refresh clean food drink beer ice cream fresh coconut fabulous must tryyou careful sun burnt

Content: A place for couples to go and have a relaxing trip. Visit to the beach is a must. A good shopping area nearby called Bali collection. Lot of eating and shopping options
review: place couple go relax trip visit must good shop area nearby call bali collection lot eat shopping option

Content: It was very shallow so we could walk a bit, swim a bit and spend time relaxing.  be careful about the coral rocks though, some parts of the beach are filled with them and they can hurt to walk on.
review: shallow walk bit swim bit spend time relax careful coral rock though part fill hurt walk

Content: Most beautiful clean beach  lounges right to the sand and beaut beach bar and food available lovely end of day watching the sun go down

Content: great beach for sports, a fair bit of rubbish near water's edge, also some nasty rocks in actual water so care to be taken.

Content: Nusa Dui beach is not bad, it's swim able with clear enough water. White sand but the tide was very low at the time I went. Not much waves, more like a swimming beach than surfing. Lots of Russian tourists sun tanning on the beach. There's better beaches in Bali. Average but not great, cleaner than seminyak beach.
review: nusa duo bad swim able clear enough water white sand tide low time go much wave swim surf lot russian tourist sun tan there well beach bali average great cleaner seminyak

Content: Beautiful clean beach for a quiet peaceful vacation. Lot of high end hotels and resorts lined up. Good place for a family get together. Away from the crowd for which bali is famous. Though away from busy bali there are options for food at decent walking distance.
review: beautiful clean quiet peaceful vacation lot high end hotel resort line good place family together away crowd bali famous though away busy bali option food decent walking distance

Content: The Ayodya Hotel has a provate beach with security and a nearby salt water pool if you don't want to go in the sea.  Very clean and a lovely spot to just hang out.  Some did - all day!

Content: We enjoyed this beach, the waves break far out leaving it calm and safe for the children. My only thing would be to say to the local community and hotels in the beach to please have a concerted effort to clean up the plastic daily, if not twice daily to take the plastic out of the ocean and stop producing plastic in the island too.

Content: We stayed there for 9 nights in Inaya outri hotel. Quiet and relaxing location. Bit boring for friends.

Content: Very nice and calm beach with withe sand and beautiful view to the horizon. Perfect water conditions clean beach and ideal for kids as they can walk into the sea.

The resorts clean there own little sections of sand where their guests could sit, but what an awful view. To be fair, i didn't see when the tide was up,could look nicer. But I wouldn't set foot in there either way after seeing it.

Content: This is an amazing beach beautiful white sand that stretches for miles. You are able to walk on a footpath or hire bikes. The path takes you pass all the wonderful resorts on this side of the island. Lots of places to stop for a meal or drinks lots of water activities offered as well.
review: amaze beautiful white sand stretch mile able walk footpath hire bike path take pas wonderful resort side island lot place stop meal drink lot water activity offer well

Content: Great location, friendly and very helpful locals. Balinese people mostly are quite hospitable. Definitely will be returning

Content: This beach in Nusa Dua is georgous and would say it’s one of the best ones I have seen. We are in Seminyak right now and there is no comparison. It’s quite and very clean they are always cleaning the beach 🏖. Highly recommend
review: nusa dua georgous say one best one see seminyak right now comparison quite clean always clean highly recommend

Content: Gorgeous beach, located away from the hussle and bussle of the city, it’s perfect for couples and families to lounge on. We stayed with our family of 3 and had a great time
review: gorgeous locate away hussle bussle city perfect couple family lounge stay family 3 great time

Content: Visited the Nusa Dua beach and it is definitely well maintained. It is also heavily guarded; you have to get through the guard booth just to drive into the beach area and there were guards walking around the beach area everywhere. It's a family-friendly beach with numerous accommodation lining up the beach front. We spoke to one of the water-sports personnel at the beach and took the boat to another part of the beach where we did parasailing, flying fish and jetski. It might not seem like so, but prices for the water sports is actually negotiable; depending on your charm level. I wasn't confident controlling the jetski on my own so I requested for a staff to sit behind me as "backup" and they readily did. We spent a long time trying out the various water sports and ended up with a great time!
review: visit nusa dua definitely well maintain heavily guard guard booth drive area guard walk around area everywhere familyfriendly numerous accommodation line front speak one watersports personnel take boat another part parasailing fly fish jetski might seem price water sport actually negotiable depend charm level wasnt confident control jetski request staff sit behind backup readily spend long time try various water sport end great time

Content: Don't get it wrong, I love Bali and I love Balinese stuff however this doesn't apply on this place. Overpriced water sports, polluted sea for scuba divers and unfortunately almost no fish for snorkelling.
review: dont wrong love bali love balinese stuff doesnt apply place overpriced water sport pollute sea scuba diver unfortunately almost fish snorkelling

Content: The white sands of this clean beach makes it a great chill out spot. Lots of water sports on offer by the surrounding hotels and good restaurants to visit at night. No harassment by folks trying to sell their goods.
review: white sand clean make great chill spot lots water sport offer surround hotel good restaurant visit night harassment folk try sell good

review: nan

Content: Excellent location, neat  and clean and clear white sand with blue water beach. Good for family and kids.
review: excellent location neat clean clear white sand blue water good family kid

Content: We walked the full length of the walkway along the Nusa Dua Beach every morning after having enjoyed the sunrise. We enjoyed the atmosphere of the local people setting up their shops and stands as well as meeting all the other visitors on their respective morning jogging or bicycle ride.

Content: Hi,It is a place to visit if you are around, I found it a good place to stay with family and close to the resorts and hotels. Many surfers there but they do not interfere with the swimmers. Some basic restorants can be found over there for a decent lunch.The beach is good but unfortunately we saw some trash in the beach (plastic bags, etc). Even though some people is cleaning the beach in the afternoon it seems that it is not enough to keep it clean. A lot of more work should be done to improve the cleanliness of this place.
review: hiit place visit around find good place stay family close resort hotel many surfer interfere swimmer basic restorants find decent lunchthe good unfortunately saw trash plastic bag etc even though people clean afternoon seem enough keep clean lot work do improve cleanliness place

Content: Beautiful when the tide is in,  but a bit bleak when the tide is out. Very nice walk from the temple on the headland to Sofitel. Also a nice path at the back of the beach for cycling
review: beautiful tide bit bleak tide nice walk temple headland sofitel nice path back cycling

Content: Went there during my recent stay for the first time.  It's a good beach for kids as the sand is clean and the wave break far out so they are pretty small when getting to the coast.
review: go recent stay first time good kid sand clean wave break far pretty small get coast

Content: The beach was dirty full of people being herded towards the different activities available. Not nice at all. I just wish we had not wasted out time going there. The experience was really not enjoyable at all!
review: dirty full people herd towards different activity available nice wish waste time go experience really enjoyable

Content: Nusa dua beach is beautiful and heaven for surfers had a amazing time at this beach as it is not crowded and good for sunrise 🌅 would suggest must visit once as it's near to the Bali collection mall
review: nusa dua beautiful heaven surfer amazing time crowd good sunrise suggest must visit near bali collection mall

Content: Long.. clean.. widely stretched beautiful beach.. the water is so clear as you go deep, but from the start its just like any other
review: long clean widely stretch beautiful water clear go deep start

Content: Nusa Dua is long stretch which I would describe in two sections.The first/northern part with the promenade marked on maps is beach with pricey resorts which take their section of the beach and water sports.The second/southern part (Mengiat beach) we liked much better as there is no section designated to a resort. This is nice long stretch of clean sandy beach where you can get sun chairs and umbrellas (or not if you do not want to), you can hire a kayak or just enjoy swimming or snorkeling. This was our favorite place which we have visited several times.
review: nusa dua long stretch describe two sectionsthe firstnorthern part promenade mark map pricey resort take section water sportsthe secondsouthern part mengiat like much good section designate resort nice long stretch clean sandy sun chair umbrellas want hire kayak enjoy swim snorkel favorite place visit several time

Content: A nice strip of beach that runs along from the Ayodya past the Grand Hyatt Bali.Generally very clean compared to Tanjong Benoa etc.Many activities but do not go if you are looking for water sports.That,s what makes this area more relaxing and there are many hotel bars and food places along this strip.Try the Ayodya beach area for the lowest price beers and cocktails plus tasty food.You can even lounge there in the bean bags if you want to.
review: nice strip run along ayodya past grand hyatt baligenerally clean compare tanjong benoa etcmany activity go look water sportsthats make area relax many hotel bar food place along striptry ayodya area low price beer cocktails plus tasty foodyou even lounge bean bag want

Content: Whiter sands and a quieter beach, but the sand is not as silky soft as Kuta. Water is very clear. It's surrounded by posh hotels, so most stretches of the beach are "private" access through one of the hotels fronting the beach. Great for sunset strolls!
review: whiter sand quieter sand silky soft kuta water clear surround posh hotel stretch private access one hotel front great sunset stroll

Content: I would definitely say that without a doubt Nusa Dua is the cleanest beach in Bali (that we've seen anyway) with beautiful white sandy beaches and very clean ocean water.
review: definitely say without doubt nusa dua cleanest bali weve see anyway beautiful white sandy beach clean ocean water

Content: Beach are very busy with boats, not a great swimming area. The beach at Kuta much better for swimming.
review: busy boat great swim area kuta much well swim

Content: Though we did not spend more time on this beach as we were staying in a beach property, the Nusa Dua Beach is known for the variety of water sports activity and scuba diving.   Literally a day would seem too short to complete the beach sports activities.  We did not dive here as the waters are known to have currents, hence had to drive down for about  4  hours to a place called Tulamben.
review: though spend time stay property nusa dua know variety water sport activity scuba dive literally day seem short complete sport activity dive water know current drive 4 hour place call tulamben

Content: been there with my family, it is really good beach having clear blue water and nice view, had a bar around nice to spend 2-3 hours with family...

Content: You you've been to the white sand beaches you will be disappointed here.  The sand is light brown and the the beach gets deep right away.

Content: if you want rest and relaxation stay or visit this area.so much different to kuta or legian.just dream and have fun.

Content: This beach by far is much better than Seminyak beach.The area is surrounded by luxury hotels.  The sand is not as white as Cancun but somewhere between. The water is clear but during high tide, there is debris and some trash washing up.The hotel staff are diligent at cleaning but there is only so much they can do.
review: far much good seminyak beachthe area surround luxury hotel sand white cancun somewhere water clear high tide debris trash wash upthe hotel staff diligent cleaning much

Content: The beach is very beautiful and calm. Mostly only high end hotels here, not crowded. Was great to enjoy the camel ride on the beach.

Content: Nusa Dua is a vast and long beach, so quiet and beautiful, BUT the water in the ocean is full of plastics, papers and rubbish. What a pity, we used the swimming pool only because of the water pollution. Local say that the wastes are coming from the neighboring island Lombock. Whatever is the reason it is an unpleasant fact and significantly will repel the tourists.
review: nusa dua vast long quiet beautiful water ocean full plastic paper rubbish pity use swim pool water pollution local say waste come neighbor island lombock whatever reason unpleasant fact significantly will repel tourist

Content: One of the best beaches around. Beautiful location, fine sands, clear blue water. A great place for a swim or just laze in the sun.

Content: Beach look great but water and sand covered in rubbish. Really disappointing. Hotels and local authorities really need to fix this problem or no one will want to go here.

Content: is acctually if you want visit the clean beach,nusa dua is good choice and also we can have a relax there because is also quiet beach,and dont forget also to visit the waterblow inside nusa dua beach.

Content: Lovely beach. Quiet for Bali    Nice Cafes restaurants beach hire.   Cool and clean.  Nice for families.  Saw some flagged area.  Calm. Lovely.  Can get massage.  Not many hawkers.
review: lovely quiet bali nice cafe restaurant hire cool clean nice family saw flagged area calm lovely massage many hawker

Content: Great beach to take walks on. We hired bikes and were able to see a lot more following the walking path
review: great take walk hire bike able see lot follow walk path

Content: This beach is very picturesque.  Yellow sand and turquoise, warm water. The beach was half-full but still very quiet and peaceful. The only downsides are the sand is a little grainy in a theraputic sort of way at times but not super soft and the sea has quite a few stones and seaweed so it can be a bit uncomfortable to swim in at times.  This beach is best for sunbathing on and if you want to take strolls on the beach.
review: picturesque yellow sand turquoise warm water halffull still quiet peaceful downside sand little grainy theraputic sort way time super soft sea quite stone seaweed bit uncomfortable swim time best sunbathe want take stroll

Content: The only unenjoyable thing about doing Water Sports in Nusa Dua is negotiating the prices with the operators. There are dozens of companies lined up along the beach, one after the other, all after your business. They vast majority of them will charge you as much as they can and make the whole process very confusing. The 1st thing you need to do is research your prices. We found some great prices on the Wira Water website and we used them as a negotiating tool. The prices are less than half of what operators will try and charge you. The 2nd thing you need to know is that if you let your taxi or shuttle driver enter the car park of any business, they will get a 5% cut of whatever you spend. Tell them to park outside and send someone off to talk to the various operators until they find the right one. There were 9 people in our group. We negotiated the internet prices with a further 10% off the prices found on the internet and no additional credit card fees (usually an extra 4%). The whole group had a 15 minute jet ski, tandem parasail, banana boat and four people did the flying fish. In total Cost was 2,500,000 IDR or around $250AUD. Very reasonable! Also the operators were happy because we didn’t book it through the internet agency and therefore cut out an extra middle man. Last time we were in Bali we all wanted to go parasailing and booked through an agency in Seminyak. When we arrived at Nusa Dua they told us that it was too windy and they weren’t doing parasailing. We asked for a refund and they said they couldn’t and we had to pick another activity.
review: unenjoyable thing water sport nusa dua negotiate price operator dozens company line along one business vast majority will charge much make whole process confuse 1st thing need research price find great price wira water website use negotiate tool price less half operator will try charge 2nd thing need know let taxi shuttle driver enter car park business will 5 cut whatever spend tell park outside send someone talk various operator find right one 9 people group negotiate internet price 10 price find internet additional credit card fee usually extra 4 whole group 15 minute jet ski tandem parasail banana boat four people fly fish total cost 2500000 idr around 250aud reasonable operator happy didnt book internet agency cut extra middle man last time bali want go parasailing book agency seminyak arrive nusa dua tell u windy werent parasailing ask refund say couldnt pick another activity

Content: The beach is OK. The sand is not thin and nice but you can, with some practice build a sand castle. :)The water is clear and clean, which you can be sure because of the amount of algae in the water, which makes it really annoying to swim. There are also a lot of stones half buried in the sand and the water is really shallow (10 meters in, 1m deep). There is the occasion plastic bag swimming but I’d not consider it dirty because of this. There are beach sellers for water sports and massages but they as you once and if you refuse they don’t bother you again. The really annoying part are the jet skis and other water sport boats going up and down the beach the whole day making noise and bringing the smell of gasoline to your nostrils the whole time.

Content: Stayed here around 2015 and thought it was really good. The facilities are good but not as good as the grand Hyatt. The fitness centre was really good, the pool was nice and all the resturants were really good. The breakfast was amazing and was much better than the grand Hyatt. The lobby was incredible and is one of the best I have seen. However when I stayed there wifi wasn't free in the rooms so I had to go to the pool or lobby to get internet access. I'm not sure if this has changed or not. The rooms were very nice and they weren't noisy at all compared to the grand Hyatt which is much older. Overall I think it's a nice place to stay, it's not as close to the connection centre compared to the grand Hyatt but it is a great hotel and I will possibly go back again.

There are plenty of restaurants along this stretch, so if you are peckish or thirsty you don't have far to go. Our only gripe was the rocks and loose coral in the shallows, but once you navigate over these, the swimming is fine.

Content: If you're used to the stressful salespeople covering the majority of the tourist beaches in Bali, come to Nusa Dua beach and relax! The beach itself is beautiful, and the water is crystal clear. Swimming would be great for kids as the water isn't too deep and the water is also pretty warm. If you're keen for a day out around the beach there's plenty to do - check out the hope gardens, the agendaz club (free swimming pool), and the Bali collection for food!

Content: THis one is for all the Australian traveller, make sure you stop and meet Maria/Nyomin and the gang at this AWESOME little traditional Bali Cafe, Dont worry about the bali belly here, Home made Chips are the best, Very cheap and top quality food, prepared by Indonesians that know how to prepare western food.PLease support our friends, they have an awesome cook and you can get a ice cold mug for your beer - How good is that. Content: We highly recommend Made Chepot +6281 338 174 561 He collected us from our hotel In Nusa Dua ahead of our pick up time and helped us plan our itinerary, ensuring we went to the places in order of how busy they would be and the traffic to get there. Content: I was really surprised by the water quality when I came there. It was absolutely crystal clear so that I could see my toes in the water while being submerged up to my chest in water. No waves at all (because of the coral reef belt surrounding the area in the distance), but there is at times a strong current (strong enough to make standing still on your feet difficult) flowing along the coast line from right to left so be careful. And yeah there are so many beautiful fishes in the water and sea creature, inhabitants of the coral reef! You just need to swim maybe some 20-30 metres away from the shore to find them (and the water will be still up to your neck only).But beware of sea snakes which I saw twice in the water. Although they're mild-tempered and reluctant to waste their venom on us, they attack if provoked. So the best option would be swimming with goggles or snorkeling with a mask and watching where you're placing your feet if you swim far enough from the shore.The beach has clean sand with no rubbish on it. And there weren't many people on it!

Content: The beaches in Nusa Dua are very good, they are everything you can expect from a beach.You can enjoy wonderful cafés or do a massage while you enjoy the sun. The water is always in a good temperature. You can choose to be on the shadow or on the sun. The only problem i found in Bali is the pollution. The non-touristic areas are full of plastics on the floor (the touristic areas are clean). Those plastics end going to the ocean (in the beach, you will see plastics on the water). If you go to Bali, tell the local people to preserve the ocean, by giving the plastic a proper treatment.

Content: I entered the beach area from a pedestrian walkway from the scooter park at the Bay Bali.    When assessing the Nusa Dua beach I am Referring to the public beach at the entry points where most people seem to stay in this area (and are supposed to stay?).  I am rating the public beach sections. To your left as you come out is the more northerly section to the left, strictly speaking this is Nusa Dua beach.  It is a sand and rock beach bounded by massive, and I mean massive, walls of sandbags to protect the coast.  There is another section to your right that is more attractive and the start of the longer southerly section, which has other named beach sections.  At this end it’s ok but the ubiquitous plastic seems to gravitate to this end, so walk further south.  If you look at some maps the whole beach for the next 4km is labelled Nusa Dua beach, however a succession of hotels adopt each section of beach. So although you are not discouraged or checked you get the feeling most locals don’t penetrate to the far end of the beach which took about a 45 minutes stroll. At the end there is a long curving jetty looking up to the Monastery which is not accessible from the beach.  It gets cleaner and here are less people the further you walk up the beach. Overall a nice beach but I wouldn’t travel from Seminak again to go there, although I would say that it looks cleaner water. I also think it’s much cleaner than the beaches going up further north on the Nusa Dua peninsula which gets nearer and nearer to the port traffic and all the pollutants that go with ports.

Content: There is something you should know about Nusa Dua Beach.  While it is always fascinating to look and provides excellent facilities, there is high tide and low tide.  At low tide you can make an inventory of everything you were stepping on trying to make your way into the water.  This is not the Carribean, there are interesting water creatures like nasty looking seastars, and some garbage always is being brought to the shore washed by the waves.  The view of the sunrise and the walkway along the beach make up for it though. You can walk, bike, run the long path connecting all the hotels on one side the gardens and the other the view and breeze provided by the sea.

Content: Water colour is beautiful and blue, sand is golden, you can walk quite far out and it's still fairly shallow so great for kids...also no hawkers bothering you, no jellyfish, very relaxing...my only complaint is the litter. Walked into the ocean to see floating plastic carrier bags, juice cartons and chip packets....PLEASE put litter in the bins. I actually went down the beach collecting some litter in one of the plastic bin bags, a lot of the holiday makers just looked at me in amazement, litter is everyone's problem whether on Holiday or not!  A tractor goes up and down the beach at least 2 times per day raking the sand and the Grand Hyatt does send out a couple of guys who have big bin liners who try their best to pick up the smaller stuff.That aside it is a relaxing place to unwind and just around the corner at The Bay is a beautiful turquoise cove which is perfect for kids too. Would love to be back there now, sitting on my sun lounger under the shade of one of the trees.

Content: The beach is lovely and the water is clean and clear. The walk along either end of the beach is good for a work out as the sand is soft and like quicksand closer to the water. Really loved walking along looking at the shells and saying hello to the fishermen.  If it is really hard going you can also go along the footpath that runs from one end of the beach to the other.  At the blowhole end there are markets.  Its great to walk along and check out each hotel and then stop for lunch or dinner.  You can get to the Bali Connection shops through the Hyatt, which may not be allowed but we snuck through!  I don't know what the beach is like during high season but we found it great and not crowded. Lovely at night too.
review: lovely water clean clear walk along either end good work sand soft quicksand closer water really love walk along look shell say hello fisherman really hard go go along footpath run one end blowhole end market great walk along check hotel stop lunch dinner bali connection shop hyatt may allow snuck dont know high season find great crowded lovely night

Content: Very pretty, clean beach. Many people are here so it could be crowded. But I would def say it's top 10 in Bali.
review: pretty clean many people crowd def say top 10 bali

Content: good for water sports.peaceful location.not good for bathing..food is ok, a bit expensive. water is clear.
review: good water sportspeaceful locationnot good bathingfood ok bit expensive water clear

Content: Great beach. Soft waves. Lots of small be cases to choose from. Vendors available and lots of hotel restaurants to have coffee and chill. Quiet and peaceful. Plenty of water sports available.
review: great soft wave lot small case choose vendor available lot hotel restaurant coffee chill quiet peaceful plenty water sport available

Content: I visited this place for 4 times in last 3/4 years. Its very clean. It has access from almost all 5 star hotel and resorts. Beach game and sea sports also available.
review: visited place 4 time last 34 year clean access almost 5 star hotel resort game sea sport available

Content: the most part of beach is cover by the hotel and resort.not many people around the beach, so if you are people who like quite and good sunbathing, this is the place for you.

Content: gorgeous beach and sunrise! love to be walking on the boardwalk and look at the spectacular view. incredible people and food....
review: gorgeous sunrise love walk boardwalk look spectacular view incredible people food

Content: Nice sand, good water for swimming, and plenty of lounge chairs with umbrellas all along the beach.  There are plenty of bars and restaurants along with many locals hawking their various goods.  It’s a good beach with a fun vibe.
review: nice sand good water swim plenty lounge chair umbrellas along plenty bar restaurant along many local hawk various good good fun vibe

Content: nice mixed experience of green gardens and beach... and this beach is peaceful although many tourists there ( we went on high season in July 2017)...
review: nice mixed experience green garden peaceful although many tourist go high season july 2017

Content: A truly incredible beach with Crystal clear water and Mt. Agung as a backdrop. We were at the Sofitel Nusa Dua hotel, so we were also supplied with cold refresher towels regularly. The beach is very clean too.
review: truly incredible crystal clear water mt agung backdrop sofitel nusa dua hotel supply cold refresher towel regularly clean

Content: Nusa Dua Beach is the best beach is Bali for families. It has shallow and clean water. Lots of great restaurants.
review: nusa dua best bali family shallow clean water lot great restaurant

Content: We live in WA so usually when we get a beach holiday elsewhere we can be disappointed. Not this time. The scene is reminiscent of an advert for Bounty chocolate. Lots to do as well. Paradise

Content: lovely beach very clean with smallish waves, and not anyone hassling you to buy stuff.  Would go again.
review: lovely clean smallish wave anyone hassle buy stuff go

Content: there are a lot of beach sellers on this beach they are licensed and you only need to say no politely and they move on, to be replaced by another one.

Content: than another place, Nusa Dua is quite far from middle town. but if you need some private area, you can get much here
review: another place nusa dua quite far middle town need private area much

Content: Nusa Dua is dominated by 5 star resort with shady trees and beach chairs while the Jombaran Beach is reserved only for sunset seafood dining. Bali is so well endowed with kilometres and kilometres of sandy beaches that every part of the island can be carved out for different activities! With the hot sun during the day, hotels at Nusa Dua has done a great job in softening it up with investing in rows and rows of trees and shades, beach chairs, seaside activities... What a place to relax! There is a small portion open to the public. Beach chairs can be rented along the public section
review: nusa dua dominate 5 star resort shady tree chair jombaran reserve sunset seafood din bali well endowed kilometre kilometres sandy beach every part island carve different activity hot sun day hotel nusa dua do great job soften invest row row tree shade chair seaside activity place relax small portion open public chair rent along public section

Content: Beautiful Indian Ocean. Clear waters and amazing view. Can sit there all day relaxing by the sea. Can be a little rough in January.
review: beautiful indian ocean clear water amaze view sit day relax sea little rough january

Content: This beach is nothing to rave about. It is protected by an enclosed reef over which the surf breaks making quite a picture.The sand is very coarse and soft making it hard to walk on.In the mornings a team of beach cleaners remove seaweed from the waters edge and bury it in the sand.  They also remove the countless plastic bottles that were washed up overnight and presumably send it off for recycling.A nice beach to look at but I wouldn’t swim in the water.
review: nothing rave protect enclose reef surf break make quite picturethe sand coarse soft make hard walk onin morning team cleaner remove seaweed water edge bury sand remove countless plastic bottle wash overnight presumably send recyclinga nice look wouldnt swim water

Content: We went there in month of march so it was very hot. Walking on beach was also tough as sand had heated up so much. Water activities are average with lack of safety and clean and equipments , specially for sea walk.
review: go month march hot walk tough sand heat much water activity average lack safety clean equipment specially sea walk

Content: A very beautiful and lively beach, with some good beach activities. We were lucky to see an ongoing festival, which made our visit even more special. Water was not very deep, so the kids had a lot of fun. Definitely, one of the best beaches Bali has to offer.
review: beautiful lively good activity lucky see ongoing festival make visit even special water deep kid lot fun definitely one best beach bali offer

Content: The place overall it's very nice, a lot of nice hotels are around, but we did't have a very good expirience on the beach... First of all the wather was very dirty, it was hot but it wasn't nice to swim or enjoy in the wather which was that dirty. When we got out of the wather it was very windy so the sand was all over us, we were hoping that the wind will stop, but it didn't... The other thing that we didn't like was that you have signs on the beach that if you go in the wather you will swim on your own responsability, when you will see red flag on the beach it's high danger, the yellow flag shows medium danger, and the green flag shows no danger at all, but we were walking a lot and all we saw was the red flag, so it was not nice to swim in wather and know that there is a risk something to happen to you... If you are not swimer you can just seat and enjoy in the view, the beach it's beautifull in that point, nice white sand and blue sea...
review: place overall nice lot nice hotel around didt good expirience first wather dirty hot wasnt nice swim enjoy wather dirty get wather windy sand u hop wind will stop didnt thing didnt sign go wather will swim responsability will see red flag high danger yellow flag show medium danger green flag show danger walk lot saw red flag nice swim wather know risk something happen swimer seat enjoy view beautifull point nice white sand blue sea

Content: This beach has the best waves and the cleanest water by far. One can walk along the beach for quite a while and just relax and enjoy the sound of the waves.
review: best wave cleanest water far one walk along quite relax enjoy sound wave

Content: Great beach. Especially at low tide because the reef protects a huge lagoon. Warm clear water. Friendly locals.
review: great especially low tide reef protect huge lagoon warm clear water friendly local

Content: Water is turquoise and calm during low tide. The view is spectacular and beach is clean! Just gorgeous
review: water turquoise calm low tide view spectacular clean gorgeous

Content: Beautiful long beach with a nice Beach walk overlooking all the gorgeous resorts on one side and the Ocean on the other. Do not stop to talk to the hawkers. They are quite annoying.

Content: Courteous staff..Good food....Water front...Good Dal Makani...Indian food, Amazing Sea Food restaurant IKAN

Content: This space is very nice ,water and area is clean ..to many people's but ok is normal ..if you visit Bali visit this area
review: space nice water area clean many people ok normal visit bali visit area

Content: Everything, just be aware the eat as much as you like buffet can be expensive. Beach is fantastic and always very clean. Staff in the hotel are amazing.

Content: Nusa Dua beaches are by far the best in bali.. white sand and blue water! If I was to return to Bali for another beach holiday, Id go back for sure!
review: nusa dua beach far best bali white sand blue water return bali another holiday id go back sure

Content: Nusa Dua Beach is more clean than Kuta and very beautiful. You can enjoy more by some private beach such St.Regis Resort
review: nusa dua clean kuta beautiful enjoy private stregis resort

Content: We enjoyed walking the beach here. We didn't go swimming.The beach was very quiet. Hotels have their sun loungers under trees on Beachfront. Also had a big swing on the beach. Lovely place to spend a few hours here. Very Relaxing.
review: enjoy walk didnt go swimmingthe quiet hotel sun lounger tree beachfront big swing lovely place spend hour relax

Content: Nusa Dua beach is inside a hotel complex where you would either see tourists or hotel personnel. The hotels are quite packed with each other as well.
review: nusa dua inside hotel complex either see tourist hotel personnel hotel quite pack well

Content: Very nice beach, cleaner than the beaches in Bali. The personal cleans it always. The ocean is amazingly blue, and we liked the low-tide also, when you can walk lot of meters in the ocean.
review: nice cleaner beach bali personal clean always ocean amazingly blue like lowtide walk lot meter ocean

Content: I have spent a long weekend at the Grand Hyatt with the family and that beach was kept in perfect shape. Staff kept on cleaning the beach front, especially during low tide. There was no rubbish floating around and as there were no boats allowed either, there was no pollution. You were able to walk for miles and miles and if you wanted could stop at either the various hotels or bars along the beach.
review: spent long weekend grand hyatt family keep perfect shape staff keep clean front especially low tide rubbish float around boat allow either pollution able walk mile mile want stop either various hotel bar along

Content: We were staying at the Amarterra Villas just up the road & our private beach area was located on the stretch of sand amongst all the 5 star hotels. There is a path that leads from one end of Nus Dua to another. St Regis, Sheraton, Westin, Grand Hyatt plus endless others are all connected along this path which makes it a very interesting stroll especially early evenings & late afternoons when the locals all come out to fish & swim. The beach is gorgeous although no waves due to the reef it was still beautiful & clean with golden sand. There is a public beach area with car-parking, umbrella & deck chair hire at Pantai Mengiat. The café  Warung Yasa Segara runs numerous reef snorkelling tours from the café. If visiting the area its a must do to try the wonderful food at Warung Yasa Segara café as its extremely cheap & fresh. It was one of the best meals we had in Bali. Just next door to the Warung Yasa  Café there is a community run massage shop which is locally run where you can pick up a cheap massage, manicure or pedicure. You can identify the ladies by their pink t-shirts.
review: stay amarterra villa road private area locate stretch sand amongst 5 star hotel path lead one end nu dua another st regis sheraton westin grand hyatt plus endless others connect along path make interesting stroll especially early evening late afternoon local come fish swim gorgeous although wave due reef still beautiful clean golden sand public area carparking umbrella deck chair hire pantai mengiat café warung yasa segara run numerous reef snorkelling tour café visit area must try wonderful food warung yasa segara café extremely cheap fresh one best meal bali next door warung yasa café community run massage shop locally run pick cheap massage manicure pedicure identify lady pink tshirts

Content: Perfect for the ones staying in Nusa Dua beach resorts. Spectacular views, extremely hot water, plenty of corals and colorful fishes. Best for water sports.
review: perfect one stay nusa dua resort spectacular view extremely hot water plenty coral colorful fish best water sport

Content: We hired a jetski and it was fantastic. My partner also really enjoyed the surf. He did lots of cool tricks on his surfboard because he is really good.
review: hire jetski fantastic partner really enjoyed surf lot cool trick surfboard really good

Content: Have been staying at a resort in Nusa Fua area and we have been swimming every day.Water was good, not very salty, cold at the beginning but then you get used to it.At the shore the beach had many algae.In the afternoon the water goes in and you can walk where the water was.
review: stay resort nusa fua area swim every daywater good salty cold beginning use itat shore many algaein afternoon water go walk water

Content: we took the package of snorkelling , jetski and turtle island. snorkelling was average with free underwater camera thrown in gratis . I think Tioman is better. the waters are not crystal clear but fishes are there. Turtle island was fun for the kids - lots of animals at close proximity for photographs. Nice and friendly guides.Jetskis are new and fun but the 15 miniutes promised turned out to be 11 minutes. complained to the timekeeper but just got waved off. there is shower after the whole affair . overall goodretrospectively , should have bargained for a lower price or more activities thrown in. Our driver reminded us but we forgot
review: take package snorkelling jetski turtle island snorkelling average free underwater camera thrown gratis think tioman good water crystal clear fish turtle island fun kid lot animal close proximity photograph nice friendly guidesjetskis new fun 15 miniutes promise turn 11 minute complain timekeeper got wave shower whole affair overall goodretrospectively bargain low price activity thrown driver remind u forget

Content: Water was perfect temp and clean watch out for the coral under foot though ! ..  nice to body surf some good waves ... the beach itself is very nice, clean with beautiful sand..  a beautiful beach all up

Content: A fabulous beach!  If the tide is up there is the opportunity for lots of water sports as well as playing in the sand which is still there.  When the tide is low, the shallows are wonderful for relaxing in and there are lots of rockpools to explore.  Wildlife is super!
review: fabulous tide opportunity lot water sport well play sand still tide low shallow wonderful relax lot rockpools explore wildlife super

Content: this beach is quite clean compared to other beaches of Bali. The slope of beach is quite high making it dangerous for small kids but for adults it is great for swimming.
review: quite clean compare beach bali slope quite high make dangerous small kid adult great swimming

Content: I'm assuming that the beach we visited from our hotel (Courtyard Marriott) was Nusa Dua Beach. If it wasn't then apologies for the review. We walked along the Beach area and it was quite well manicured but was large hotel after hotel after hotel after hotel. The sunbeds were quite crowded as well as the bed/pavilion structures. Hotel restaurants all the way along. We are leaving early to try Ubud then Gili. Fingers crossed
review: im assume visited hotel courtyard marriott nusa dua wasnt apology review walk along area quite well manicured large hotel hotel hotel hotel sunbeds quite crowd well bedpavilion structure hotel restaurant way along leave early try ubud gili finger cross

Content: Loved the food, great cocktails, lazing about by the pool or beach, beautiful people, sunsets and scenery. Plenty to see and do.

Content: I think a good second to Jimbaran beach on Bali islandPleasant and nice and they say good for Surfers

Content: We found these beaches really dirty and unswimmable. There were condoms, needles, and so much garbage on the beaches we were shocked. All outside the major resorts. Quite surprising and disappointed as we expected white sand and blue seas. Like the brochures.  We stayed at the pool.

Content: I visited the Nusa Dua Beach during my stay at the Mercure Hotel in Nusa Dua. There was a dedicated Mercure beach area which was quiet nice. The atmosphere in general is rather relaxed and less populated with locals like the Kuta/ Legion beaches. I would recommend a visit to the beach if you prefer a cleaner and quieter experience. Plenty of water sports and activities available if thats what you're looking to do.

Content: Having walked the length of this beach there does appear to be some resorts who put a little extra effort in cleaning up the beach front than others. There is a reef pretty close in and this appears to be popular with local fishermen at night. The swimming area is contained within a line of buoys. The walkway up from the beach is clean but again it appears that each resort looks after it's own strip. Popular with runners and people out for a walk. The local sellers aren't overly imposing and a range of items are available for sale.
review: walked length appear resort put little extra effort clean front others reef pretty close appear popular local fisherman night swim area contain within line buoy walkway clean appear resort look strip popular runner people walk local seller arent overly impose range item available sale

Content: Went during low tide .... could walk a long stretch before the dropoff. Water is clear and warm !Good for an early morning n evening dip.

Content: I was extremely surprised at the amount of garbage floating in the water.  I spent one day at the beach and it was enough.  My next day was spent poolside.

Content: Traveled for business to Nusa Dua. I guess it is my fault since I did not do any homework ahead of time but always assumed that Bali was just like the Seychelles or Mauritius. Nothing of the sort, the beach was not impressive at all, the sand is dark, and barely a soul was bathing in the water. My assumption is that most folks in Nusa Dua stay at the hotel pools but don’t bother go to the beach since it is not pretty at all. Disappointed.
review: traveled business nusa dua guess fault homework ahead time always assume bali seychelles mauritius nothing sort impressive sand dark barely soul bath water assumption folk nusa dua stay hotel pool dont bother go pretty disappointed

Content: Calm, shallow, uncrowded beach with lots of facilities for water sports. The beach is clean and uncluttered.

Content: The water is very clear. The sand is smooth. My children loves to swim just near the shore. Many children playing at that beach. The beach i went to belonged to Novotel Nusa Dua. So it is a private beach. You can order drinks and snacks at the bar too.

Content: A great classic beach that is not too crowded and beautifully relaxed. The water Color is exceptional and the crowd laid back. A far cry from Kuta. Thank goodness.

Content: Bali beachs arnt the cleanest in the world. My husband collected a bag of rubbish every day we went to the beach. There were many offering bamboo baskets on the beach everyday that are just left there.

It's very shallow and you can walk out for perhaps 2km but the entire way is blocked by banks of seaweed. i think they're trying to clean it up though, at least that's what I think I saw them doing there.

Content: The beach has a deep fall and at low tide it leaves lots of pools. Not sure how safe it is as there are mentions of sea urchins, so wear those flip-flops! There are sea turtle nests which are protected, so it would wonderful to be around as the babies surface later in June/July
review: deep fall low tide leave lot pool sure safe mention sea urchin wear flipflops sea turtle nest protect wonderful around baby surface later junejuly

Content: Came here so my husband could surf. Water was warm and beautiful. I laid on the sand with book and was as happy as could be!

Content: the security, the beach and gardens were impressive.A lot of traffic ,but to be expected due to holiday season. Watching your choice of taxi transport . Only used Bluebird as it is known to be metered ..

Content: Beautiful beach, but the water is too shallow to swim in and there is a lot of sea weed as well. We were a bit disappointed.

Content: We rented moto scooters in Jimbaran and took a drive over to Nusa Dua. What a surprise! After a long walk past all the five star hotels we stopped to check out haze beach club. The had a lunch promo so we spent the day. Best meal all trip!
review: rent moto scooter jimbaran take drive nusa dua surprise long walk past five star hotel stop check haze club lunch promo spent day best meal trip

Content: We were staying at Courtyard Marriott and the private beach shared with other mega-hotels was about 5 minutes away from Marriott by their complimentary shuttle van. At the beach, lounger beds with towels as well as shower area were made available for the hotel guests. The bar is open at 10 am. Though, it seems like a private beach, there were water sports operators as well as sellers walking around to ask if we wanted any services from them as well as exorbitant souvenirs, hence the oxymoron title of my review. The beach is cleaned separately by the hotel staffs, however, there were lots of seaweeds with the waves bringing on to the beach. However, my kids did enjoyed their time on the beach making sandcastles but not so much on the cold waters of the sea.

Content: Overall a great beach with many entertainment spot all around, to get maximum experience of the beach, check in to one of the hotel which has private beach. Content: Nusa Dua beach was the first destination we were driven to on our first day in Bali. Perhaps it's due to the fact that we are Malaysians (there are plenty of beaches in Malaysia), and that our profession allows us to indulge in sea-related activities pretty cheaply (or for free), we found that the fees associated to all "attractions" offered by operators along the beach were very much inflated. We couldn't imagine paying $40 for what looked like a 10-15 minutes of parasailing. We certainly couldn't imagine paying $40 for a 15-minute of flying fish. Or $40 for "walking under the sea with a head gear on."As soon as we communicated our intention to "just take a stroll down the beach," the tour operator told us that the beach was not safe for taking a stroll, and then she very quickly turned her back to us and started pursuing other tourists.In my opinion, it is a much overrated "tourist attraction" but if you're in Bali for its beaches and "sea-sports," then this is the place to go to.
review: nusa dua first destination drive first day bali perhaps due fact malaysian plenty beach malaysia profession allow u indulge searelated activity pretty cheaply free found fee associate attraction offer operator along much inflate couldnt imagine pay 40 looked 1015 minute parasailing certainly couldnt imagine pay 40 15minute fly fish 40 walk sea head gear onas soon communicated intention take stroll tour operator tell u safe take stroll quickly turn back u start pursue touristsin opinion much overrate tourist attraction youre bali beach seasports place go
